name: df-oposet
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(cops, crab(s0, cpo, wa(wa(wcel(cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), cdm(cfv(club, cv(s0)))), wcel(cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), cdm(cfv(cglb, cv(s0))))), wex(s1, wa(wceq(cv(s1), cfv(coc, cv(s0))), wral(s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wral(s3, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), w3a(w3a(wcel(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2)), cfv(cbs, cv(s0))), wceq(cfv(cv(s1), cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2))), cv(s2)), wi(wbr(cv(s2), cfv(cple, cv(s0)), cv(s3)), wbr(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s3)), cfv(cple, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2))))), wceq(co(cv(s2), cfv(cjn, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2))), cfv(cp1, cv(s0))), wceq(co(cv(s2), cfv(cmee, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s1), cv(s2))), cfv(cp0, cv(s0)))))))))))
comment: Define the class of orthoposets, which are bounded posets with an orthocomplementation operation. Note that ` ( Base ` p ) e. dom ( lub ` p ) ` means there is an upper bound ` 1. ` , and similarly for the ` 0. ` element. (Contributed by NM, 20-Oct-2011.) (Revised by NM, 13-Sep-2018.)
